intro: Gossypium barbadense subsp. sprucei, commonly known as the海岛棉 or海岛棉 variant, is a subspecies of cotton native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its long, fine fibers that are highly valued for their strength and quality. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a hairy texture. This subspecies is often cultivated for its high-quality cotton fibers used in textiles.
